column4: is there any way I can get 2.6.29 or .30 compiled and packaged for jaunty?

you could check the following-- under software sources--  Pre-released updates as well as unsupported updates-  then close and let the list reload (it is possible that what you are looking for may be in those)
Ok, is this the same as backports?
I think I remember on my other install that it updated to the 2.6.28  when I clicked the pre-released
it may have the 2.6.29 or .30 there but only way it to check
only other way is to download the compiler and compile it yourself
I have yet to compile my own kernel - (only done it for a few apps as well as wine)
I've done it lots of times but long ago and I wanted to avoid it right now
specially since this is for/in a netbook
If it exists it is possible it is in the Pre-release updates in the software sources
sigh it's not, they're all 2.6.28 there
one thing you may or may not want to do
go into room #ubuntu+1 and ask them what kernel karmic is
then you may want to update to the Alpha of Karmic--
though it may be your only option to get that kernel short of compiling
